I don't have information on current exhibitions, but there are several institutions and galleries that frequently feature and celebrate blackfoot art.

the glenbow museum in calgary, canada showcases an extensive collection of blackfoot art, artifacts, and culture. the blackfoot gallery at the museum features a collection of traditional and contemporary blackfoot art, including beadwork, paintings, and sculptures.

the museum of indigenous people in santa fe, new mexico, usa showcases contemporary blackfoot art along with the works of other indigenous artists in their exhibitions.

also, the blackfoot crossing historical park in alberta, canada, is a cultural center that celebrates blackfoot culture and history. the park features various exhibits and showcases blackfoot artistry.

you can also check on local art galleries, museums and exhibitions showcasing blackfoot art around your community. these resources may offer the chance to experience blackfoot art firsthand and explore the rich cultural heritage of the blackfoot people.
